poem:
Title: "Of Mortgages and Motors"

As the crow rises, over the fen's edge,
Silent still, the market's hedge.
Rates climb, inquiries wane,
Houses echo, empty in their pain.

Musk, the new-age Titan, claims his due,
Shareholders nod, a contract renewed.
Charted valleys, charted peaks,
Self-made gods amid the meek.

In the roar of engines, and silent homes,
Truth's stark visage tightly roams.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Confidence in UK housing market dips after rise in mortgage rates; Musk says Tesla shareholders back his mega pay package – business live 12.58pm BST From the RICS survey. Nationally, buyer enquiry levels have turned negative again.But when you look at the regional breakdown, we can see it varies widely, up in some regions, down in others. Northern Ireland notable for the strong surge. South East England notable for it's… pic.twitter.com/ATG9c245S9— Moving Home with Charlie". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
